HI

I study Kukishinden ryu Bojutsu

The history for this is supposed to s=
tem back to the late 1330's when Kuki
Yasushimaru was given the name Kuki b=
y Tenno Go Daigo. Or so they say.

Today Kukishin Ryu Bojutsu is also taugh=
t in the Hon Tai Yoshin Ryu. As well
as different branches of the Kukishin =
Ryu. The mainline of Kukishin Ryu no
longer studies Martial arts. The Tensh=
in Hyoho Kukishinden Ryu is connected
dirrectly to the Kuki family.

In the=
 Bujinkan Dojo Hatsumi sensei has produced a few Bojutsu videos. The
best b=
eing a kata video for the Kukishinden Ryu Bojutsu. This was made by a
Japan=
ese company. www.ninjutsu.com will sell a copy on NTSC, but if it is a
pal =
version you are after I know some one in spain and france who can supply
or=
iginal, or maybe I could copy mine for you.

paul Richardson

I beleive Taisen Deshimaru=
 Sensei was writing in the 1950's so all of his
books
are readily available=
 in English.

The Katori Shinto Ryu is considered the oldest school of boju=
tsu, I recommend
"the Diety and the Sword" by Otake for info on this school=
 and their use of
the
Bo. The standard length is usually "roku shaku" or ju=
st over six feet.
